snippet: A jury has awarded a former smoker $2 million for the cancer he attributed not to tobacco but to asbestos in the filters of cigarettes he smoked in the 1950's.   The former smoker's suit circumvented a California law that bars lawsuits against man...
lead_paragraph: A jury has awarded a former smoker $2 million for the cancer he attributed not to tobacco but to asbestos in the filters of cigarettes he smoked in the 1950's. The former smoker's suit circumvented a California law that bars lawsuits against manufacturers for tobacco-related illnesses. It could open a new line of attack against cigarette makers, lawyers and critics of the tobacco industry said, although they acknowledged that it must withstand challenges on appeal.

headline.main: Former Smoker Wins $2 Million In Lawsuit Over Cigarette Filter
